LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_PickUpAndHaul_: Pick Up And Haul is not installed
PUAH is optional, but will be enhanced if installed.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Opportunity_In:
Job report: "... on the way to ..."
Hauling on the way to a job is a vanilla feature, hence generally compatible with all mods. Some storage mods use delays, so are disallowed by default.
We skip opportunities when bleeding or forming a caravan.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_HaulBeforeCarr:
Job report: "... closer to ..."
A pawn will find the closest resource, which is sometimes awaiting delivery to storage near our job site. If we perform that haul first, they can grab extras headed to the same storage.
If a resource is already in storage of equal priority, they won't save a trip for a dedicated hauler, but can still grab resources that expedite their future work.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_PickUpAndHaulP:
We significantly enhance Pick Up And Haul by unloading only once at each destination, in closest order.
We improve performance by caching haulable destinations.

We fully integrate opportunities by ensuring our entire gather and unload path never exceeds our criteria for "opportunistic".
When hauling extra supplies or ingredients to closer storage, we grab extra random things headed to the same higher-priority storage.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingDesc_En: Toggle entire mod without restarting. Useful for troubleshooting.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingTitle_U: Use & improve Pick Up And Haul
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingDesc_Dr: Original job paths are red, new opportunistic paths are green. Original ingredient/supply paths are magenta, new optimal paths are cyan. (This is sync'd to vanilla's Development mode → inspector icon → Visibility → Draw Opportunistic Jobs.)
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingDesc_Op:
Our default is performant, but impassable walls or locked doors may confuse pawns—generally worth it for more opportunities.
Pathfinding is preferable for small colonies or fast machines.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingTitle_O: By region, then skipped (default) FPS ✔️ Opportunities ✔️ Perfect ✖️
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingDesc_Op:
Provided for explaining and tweaking vanilla's built-in opportunistic hauling.
All distances are straight-line ("as the crow flies").
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingTitle_O: Max new legs % of original trip
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingDesc_Op: Max start-to-haulable + storage-to-job % of original trip.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingTitle_O: Max total trip % of original trip
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingDesc_Op: To understand this, enable Development mode → inspector icon → Visibility → Draw Regions. Exploration begins from the start region spreading out to all neighbors until encountering the destination region. This setting caps the total number explored - even those in the wrong direction. It can't be calculated perfectly from distance, as regions will vary in size and neighbors. (A corridor has only forward and back, so they're explored further.) But in a completely open field, if a pawn must travel the distance of n=3 full-sized 12x12 regions (~36 tiles), the algorithm will explore 2(n^2+n)+1 or 25 regions.

To understand this, enable Development mode → inspector icon → Visibility → Draw Regions. Exploration begins from the start region spreading out to all neighbors until encountering the destination region. This setting caps the total number explored - even those in the wrong direction. It can't be calculated perfectly from distance, as regions will vary in size and neighbors. (A corridor has only forward and back, so they're explored further.) But in a completely open field, if a pawn must travel the distance of n=3 full-sized 12x12 regions (~36 tiles), the algorithm will explore 2(n^2+n)+1 or 25 regions.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_SettingTitle_H: Haul extra resources closer from same-priority storage
